June 10, 2019 at 8:26 AM · New York, NY ·

Congratulations to La Cima Elementary Charter School in Brooklyn, NY! Within their first year of implementation, they have seen tremendous growth in their kindergarten and first grade students’ reading skills. Their school-wide goal was 60% proficiency in reading and as of May, both kindergarten and first grade had exceeded the goal with 63% of all students meeting their Fountas and Pinnell benchmark goals.

La Cima Charter School

Edgility Consulting is supporting La Cima Charter School in the Bedford-Stuyvesant neighborhood to find its Elementary School Principal.

La Cima’s philosophy is grounded in the behavioral psychology of Dr. Carol Dweck, the theories of Paolo Freire, and Lisa Delpit which speak to education for social and political change.

La Cima is seeking a passionate and energetic turnaround school leader who is excited and prepared for the challenges of building a high-performing, independent community-based charter school.

Reporting to the Executive Director, this individual will have a strong voice in the vision and strategy for the school's evolution, expansion, and growth.

Join us for our Back to School 5K Color Fun Run, a five-kilometer, un-timed event in which all participants will be doused from head to toe in different colors at each kilometer! Sign up: bit.ly/lacima5k

There are only 5 easy-to-follow rules:

Walk or Run – Your choice!
Wear white at the starting line!
Finish plastered in color!
Have a great time!
Bring a friend!

After Color Runners complete the race, the fun continues with a Community Dance Party. There will be music, dancing and tons of color. Which House will represent the hardest?!
